address: Xã Cẩm Sơn, Huyện Mỏ Cày Nam, Tỉnh Bến Tre
thought:
**My Analysis of the Administrative Shift**

Alright, let's break this down. My goal is to determine the current administrative unit corresponding to the outdated address: "Xã Cẩm Sơn, Huyện Mỏ Cày Nam, Tỉnh Bến Tre".  I've got the old address parsed: "Xã Cẩm Sơn" (Ward), "Huyện Mỏ Cày Nam" (District), and "Tỉnh Bến Tre" (Province).

The first thing I did was look into the province-level changes. I immediately thought of Resolution 60-NQ/TW, which led me to the merger of provinces. Lo and behold, Bến Tre, Vĩnh Long, and Trà Vinh merged, forming a new province named Vĩnh Long. So, that's my starting point: the old "Tỉnh Bến Tre" is now "Tỉnh Vĩnh Long".

Next, I focused on the ward/commune level.  I had to track down any changes specifically affecting "Xã Cẩm Sơn". I began scanning resolutions, paying close attention to any mention of "Cẩm Sơn" within the context of either the old or new provinces.

I checked several resolutions, but they turned out to be false leads, as they referred to "Cẩm Sơn" in different provinces and unrelated consolidations. One resolution mentioned in the context of Bắc Ninh, Đồng Tháp, Hà Tĩnh, Nghệ An, and Quảng Ninh.

Finally, I got to 1687/NQ-UBTVQH15, a resolution from Vĩnh Long itself. This is where I hit paydirt. Line 71 mentioned "huyện Mỏ Cày Nam" the original address, but was more relevant to the old district. I will go back and check. I think I have the information I need to confirm the change.

citation.header: 1687/NQ-UBTVQH15: Sắp xếp các đơn vị hành chính cấp xã của tỉnh Vĩnh Long
citation.line: 74. Sắp xếp toàn bộ diện tích tự nhiên, quy mô dân số của các xã Ngãi Đăng, Cẩm Sơn và Hương Mỹ thành xã mới có tên gọi là xã Hương Mỹ.
